timeline.bodyText: What is this one now called?
timeline.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText: IIRC this is MENU, and there was a third name change as well. I'll look it up in Enigma.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: Yes, thats what I was worried about. For now keep it as container.
replies.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText:
The full list of changed names is:

BLOCK_ENTITY => BLOCK_ENTITY_TYPE
DIMENSION => DIMENSION_TYPE
CONTAINER => MENU
STATUS_EFFECT => MOB_EFFECT

I don't think we should give other names to registered objects, as we don't rename blocks/items/entities either (there are also awful names like area_effect_cloud there).
If we do rename some registries, I think CONTAINER and STATUS_EFFECT can have their old names and the two others can have _TYPE at the end.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: I'd rather keep STATUS_EFFECT. Besides, are there that many registries that it's essential to auto-generate names for them ?
replies.author: Pyrofab

replies.bodyText: There are 42 registries. Also, I don't see any point in mapping things that can be mapped automatically.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: Well, consistency is the main issue. I think we should override generated names when they conflict with the established ones.
replies.author: Pyrofab

replies.bodyText: I added back the old names of CONTAINER and STATUS_EFFECT. (renaming those can be a discussion issue, anyway)
replies.author: Juuxel

timeline.message: Add back manual names for Registry.MENU and Registry.MOB_EFFECT
